hero.name: Jose Rizal
hero.description: Jose Protacio Rizal Mercado y Alonzo Realonda is widely considered the national hero of the Philippines. He was a polymath who excelled in various fields, including writing, medicine, and the arts. Rizal's literary works, such as "Noli Me Tangere" and "El Filibusterismo," played a crucial role in inspiring Filipinos to fight for independence from Spanish colonial rule.

hero.name: Andres Bonifacio
hero.description: Andres Bonifacio was a key figure in the Philippine Revolution against Spanish colonial rule. He founded the secret society Katipunan, which aimed to achieve Philippine independence through armed struggle. Bonifacio played a crucial role in organizing and leading revolutionary forces, although he was later executed during internal conflicts within the revolutionary movement.
